abstract: Ohio Gov John R Kasich signs executive order that extends restrictions against ownership of exotic animals, including an increase in inspections to report possible cruelty and neglect; says that order may have prevented tragedy where 56 exotic animals illegally kept by Terry Thompson of Zanesville, Ohio, were shot and killed by the police.
snippet: The order might have prevented a Zanesville reserve owner from being able to keep dozens of animals because of his record of cruelty and neglect.
lead_paragraph: The order might have prevented a Zanesville reserve owner from being able to keep dozens of animals because of his record of cruelty and neglect.

headline.main: Ohio Governor Signs Order Seeking to Curb Animal Cruelty
headline.print_headline: Ohio Governor Signs Order To Curb Animal Cruelty
